properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 8:25PM PST until January 11 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW SHIFTING INTO IDAHO AND FAR NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...

.Snow is tapering off in the Spokane Area and on the Palouse but remains
moderate to heavy in areas of the Idaho Panhandle and far northeastern
reaches of Washington.  Light to moderate snow showers also continue
along the Cascade Crest.  Another disturbance will move into the
region overnight with light snow showers returning to most locations
across Eastern Washington and North Idaho.  Additional accumulations
of 1 to 3 inches will be possible with locally higher amounts with this
second wave into Saturday..

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to
10 inches with local mountain accumulations of 1 to 2 feet.

* WHERE...Kellogg, Pinehurst, Osburn, Wallace, Mullan, Fourth of
July Pass, Dobson Pass, and Lookout Pass.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST SATURDAY
